newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: CRH voted best Irish firm in fund manager survey.
newsitem.headline: CRH voted best Irish firm in fund manager survey.

text.p: Building materials firm CRH Plc was named best Irish company for the third consecutive year in a poll of Irish and UK investment fund managers compiled by Finance magazine.
Ireland's two leading banks Allied Irish Banks Plc and Bank of Ireland came second and third respectively in the survey which was published on Thursday.

Fund managers were asked to rate Irish companies under seven separate criteria including strategic positioning, marketing strength, accounting information, acquisitions capability and investor relations.
Fund managers said CRH's success in the investor survey was mainly due to good management strategy.
"CRH make common sense decisions which are well thought out and they have become predictable, which markets like," one fund manager told Finance.
"CRH put a lot of effort into their dealings with the fund management community and provide a lot of information in their accounts," he added.
Finance magazine said a notable feature of the 1996 survey was the emergence of a number of small progressive companies like IAWS, United Drug, Kingspan, Grafton, DCC, Tullow Oil and Clondalkin.
